snippet: As Texas sues to block Syrian refugees from resettling inside its borders, Mayor Bill de Blasio said he welcomed a dozen Texas-bound arrivals to New York City "with open arms."
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio welcomes Syrian refugees who were barred from resettlement in Texas after state sued to keep them out; de Blasio says refugees are likely to stay in city only temporarily.

byline.original: By LIZ ROBBINS and C. J. HUGHES

lead_paragraph: As Texas sues to block Syrian refugees from resettling inside its borders, Mayor Bill de Blasio said he welcomed a dozen Texas-bound arrivals to New York City "with open arms."

headline.main: Facing Resistance in Texas, Syrian Refugees Find Temporary Sanctuary in New York
headline.print_headline: Syrian Refugees Are Welcomed in New York as Texas Sues to Bar Them
